comment.author: 64496377@N05
comment._content: HMS Triumph was British pre-dreadnought battleship completed in 1904. She and her sister ship HMS Swifture were originally laid down in british shipyards  (Vickers) for the Chilean Navy, but  were purchased by the British prior to completion. HMS Triumph at the beginning of WWI was stationed in China, and participated in the chase of von Spee's cruiser squadron and later the capture of the German base at Tsing Tau China. She was later transferred to the Med, and participated in the Dardanelles Campaign. She was sunk May 25, 1915 after being torpedoed by German U-21 off Gaba Tepe Turkey.
